meanings.definition: To accustom (an infant or young mammal) to food other than its mother's milk.
meanings.sent1: The mother cat was slowly weaning her kittens onto solid food.
meanings.sent2: It is important to wean puppies onto dry food gradually.
meanings.sent3: The baby bird was weaning itself off the worm diet, much to the worm's relief.
meanings.sent4: She was weaning herself from her dependence on sugary snacks, one day at a time.
meanings.sent5: The process of weaning the baby from breast milk was a challenging but necessary step in its development.

meanings.definition: To detach from a source of dependence.
meanings.sent1: He slowly weaned himself off his addiction to video games.
meanings.sent2: The therapist helped her wean off unhealthy coping mechanisms.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to wean itself off its owner's constant attention, but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: She was weaning herself from the toxic relationship, finding strength in independence.
meanings.sent5: The company had to wean itself from relying solely on one major client for revenue, diversifying its portfolio.
